DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Bone Marrow Failure Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for information related to the assessment of the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Bone Marrow Failure Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the assessment of the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Evidence of progressive bone
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of progressive bone marrow failure with hemoglobin <11 g/dL or platelet count <100x10^9/L

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a bone marrow failure syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of marrow failure as manifested by the development or worsening of anemia or thrombocytopenia

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cytopenia as documented by a decrease of Hb levels >2 g/dL or to < 10 g/dL, or by a decrease of platelet counts > 50% or to < 100,000/microliter, which occurs at least 3 months after treatment, if the marrow biopsy demonstrates as infiltrate of clonal CLL cells.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have bloom syndrome, ataxia-telangiectasia, Fanconi anemia, Kostmann syndrome, Schwachman syndrome, or any other known bone marrow failure syndrome?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.8 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak
